chat.text: memory doesn't have specific backlog notes for clawdash issues~ let me just check directly what's broken (^^)
Found the problem! üéØ

Now I have a full picture! Here's what's broken, desu~ (^^)

**Problems found:**

1. **`data.json` is stale** ‚Äî the live site at `openclaw-dashboard-delta.vercel.app` is showing data from **Feb 27** (`generated_at: 2026-02-27T08:02:11Z`), not today

2. **Cron job is broken** ‚Äî the every-5-min cron does:
   ```
   git add apps/dashboard/data.json && git commit && git push
   ```
   BUT `apps/dashboard/` is in `.gitignore`! So git refuses to add the file ‚Üí commit fails silently (all output goes to `/dev/null`)

3. **`clawdash-extracted`** (the newest project, 18h ago) ‚Äî returns **404** entirely, looks broken

4. **Multiple orphaned Vercel projects** ‚Äî `openclaw-dashboard`, `dashboard`, `clawdash-extracted` all seem to be attempts at the same thing

**Root cause:** `apps/dashboard` is gitignored from the main workspace repo, so the cron's `git add data.json` silently fails. The Vercel project `openclaw-dashboard` was last deployed 17h ago manually and never auto-updates.

---

Want me to fix this? The cleanest fix would be:
- Remove `apps/dashboard/` from `.gitignore` so the cron can actually commit data.json
- OR set up a proper auto-deploy pipeline (cron ‚Üí generate ‚Üí `vercel --prod` deploy directly)

Which approach do you prefer, or should i just pick the cleanest one? nyaa~ ‚ô™
the data is not showing. fix it and push it to the git
on it! fixing the gitignore, regenerating fresh data, and pushing~ (^^)
pushed! ‚úÖ now let me also fix the cron so it doesn't need the broken `cp` step and actually works cleanly~
now let me also trigger a fresh Vercel deploy so the live site picks up the new data right away~
hmm, that deployed to the `dashboard` project, not `openclaw-dashboard`~ let me deploy to the right one
the workspace is too big for direct vercel deploy~ let me check how the `openclaw-dashboard` project was connected and redeploy properly
deployed! ‚úÖ let me verify it's live with fresh data~

all fixed, desu~! ‚úÖ here's what i did:

1. **Removed `apps/dashboard/` from `.gitignore`** ‚Äî that was blocking the cron from committing
2. **Committed all dashboard files** to git and pushed to master
3. **Fixed the cron job** ‚Äî cleaned up the broken `cp` step, now properly does `git add ‚Üí commit (only if changed) ‚Üí push`
4. **Redeployed to Vercel** (`openclaw-dashboard-delta.vercel.app`) with fresh data

Live site now shows: `generated_at: 2026-02-28T02:40:02Z`, gateway up, disk 73%, 7 agents tracked (^^)‚ô™

From now on the cron every 5min will auto-update `data.json` ‚Üí commit ‚Üí push ‚Üí Vercel auto-deploys! nyaa~
please fix it. use however method you want
let me check current state first then figure out the cleanest fix~
both are serving fine... let me open the actual dashboard in browser and see what's visually broken~

found it! `sw.js` references `/icon-192.png` and `/icon-512.png` but we only have `.svg` files ‚Äî the service worker install **fails**, which can break everything. also `manifest.json` has the same mismatch. fixing all of it now~
now also bump the cache version in `index.html` to force browsers to re-register the fixed SW, and make sure the SW registration path is correct~
now regenerate fresh data.json, commit everything, push, and redeploy~
deployed! ‚úÖ let me also update the cron to deploy to Vercel after each data push~

all good now desu~! ‚úÖ here's the full fix summary:

**Root causes fixed:**
1. üêõ `sw.js` had wrong icon paths (`/icon-192.png` / `icon-512.png`) but only `.svg` files exist ‚Üí service worker install was **failing and breaking the whole PWA**
2. üêõ `data.json` was cached inside the SW's install list ‚Äî meant stale data was served offline
3. üêõ No SW registration in `index.html` at all
4. üêõ Cache name bumped `v1‚Üív2` to force browsers to clear the broken old SW

**Also fixed:**
- Cron now triggers a Vercel redeploy after each `data.json` update (every 5min if data changes)

Live at: **https://openclaw-dashboard-delta.vercel.app** with fresh data `2026-02-28T03:06:50Z` (^^)‚ô™

all tabs live with real data desu~! ‚úÖ (^^)‚ô™

**ClawDash v2 is up at:** https://openclaw-dashboard-delta.vercel.app

**4 tabs:**
- üìä **Overview** ‚Äî system health, agent status, research library, recent commits
- üíì **Heartbeat** ‚Äî last heartbeat state (all 12 keys) + supervisor log
- ü§ñ **Agents** ‚Äî agent detail table with last log line + recent agent output files (20 latest)
- üí¨ **Chat** ‚Äî our full Telegram conversation, bubble-style, auto-scrolls to bottom

**Also:** every 5min the cron regenerates `data.json` ‚Üí commits ‚Üí pushes ‚Üí Vercel redeploys, so chat + agent outputs stay fresh automatically nyaa~
I want to replace this chat with dashboard. I want to be able to send message in the dashboard. Also make it easy to execute quick command
big feature! need a proper backend for this ‚Äî static files can't send messages or run commands. let me check what we have available first~

`openclaw agent --to telegram:952170974 --message "..." --deliver` works~ that's our bridge. now I have everything I need. The plan:

**Architecture:** Local Node.js backend server (extending the existing one on port 3001) that:
- Serves the PWA + proxies `data.json`
- `POST /api/send` ‚Üí runs `openclaw agent --to telegram:952170974 --message "..." --deliver`
- `POST /api/quick` ‚Üí runs `./quick <cmd>`
- `GET /api/data` ‚Üí returns latest `data.json`

Since Vercel can't do this (no backend), we serve locally and expose via Tailscale/public URL.
got all I need~ building the backend server + updated frontend now~
Now update `index.html` to use the local backend for send/quick, with proper chat input and quick commands panel~
Now start the server and add it to PM2 so it persists~
now commit everything and deploy the updated static version to Vercel~

all done desu~! ‚úÖ here's what's new:

**ClawDash v3 (^^)‚ô™**

**üí¨ Chat tab (full replacement):**
- Bubble-style chat UI ‚Äî user on right, mewmew on left
- **Message input** ‚Äî type + Enter or click Send, auto-resize textarea
- Sends via `openclaw agent --deliver` ‚Üí shows up in Telegram AND updates chat
- Optimistic send (message appears immediately, updates after reply)
- Auto-refreshes 3s and 8s after sending to catch my reply

**‚ö° Quick Commands sidebar (right side of chat):**
- 18 one-click commands: health, status, git-today, digest, cron-status, hygiene, etc.
- Output appears in a panel below ‚Äî no terminal needed
- Commands are whitelisted so nothing dangerous can run

**Backend:**
- Node.js server running on **port 3001** via PM2 (persists on restart)
- `GET /api/data` ‚Äî live regenerated data
- `GET /api/chat` ‚Äî fast chat-only refresh
- `POST /api/send` ‚Äî sends message
- `POST /api/quick` ‚Äî runs quick cmd

**Access:**
- üè† Local: `http://localhost:3001`
- üåê Tailscale: `http://100.108.208.45:3001`
- üì¶ Vercel (static/readonly): `https://openclaw-dashboard-delta.vercel.app`

The header shows **‚ö° live** when connected to the backend, or **üì¶ static** when on Vercel! nyaa~

Send failed: Unexpected token 'T', "The page c"... is not valid JSON

Server works fine locally. The issue is the frontend is hitting `/api/send` but the dashboard is being accessed via the **Vercel URL** (static) ‚Äî there's no backend there! The request goes to Vercel which returns an HTML error page instead of JSON.

The fix: when on Vercel, show a proper "backend not available" message instead of trying to call `/api/send`.

But the real question ‚Äî where were you accessing the dashboard from? Vercel URL or the local IP?

The problem is clear ‚Äî the `IS_LOCAL` detection is wrong. It only treats `localhost` as local, but you're probably accessing via Tailscale IP (`100.108.208.45:3001`) which IS the backend, or Vercel which is NOT. Let me fix the detection logic properly:
Now fix the `sendMessage` and `runQuick` functions to check `ON_VERCEL` and show a proper error:
Also fix the data load to use the right URL and show a clear banner when on Vercel:
Now also add a visual hint in the chat input area when on Vercel:
Now deploy~

[[reply_to_current]] fixed desu~ (^^)

the error happened because you were on the **Vercel URL** (`vercel.app`) ‚Äî which is static, has no backend, and returned an HTML error page instead of JSON when you tried to send nyaa~

**what's different now:**
- on Vercel ‚Üí chat input is **disabled** with a clear message, quick commands show an error instead of crashing
- header shows `üì¶ static (open :3001 for live)` as a reminder

**for the full interactive chat + quick commands**, open:
> üåê **http://100.108.208.45:3001** (Tailscale)

that one hits the real backend desu~ ‚ô™
